title: Traceback: KeyError: 'exception'
body:
In GitLab by @bocekm on May 11, 2018, 07:52

**How did I install Flake8**

```
$ sudo pip install flake8
WARNING: Running pip install with root privileges is generally not a good idea. Try `pip install --user` instead.
Collecting flake8
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/b9/dc/14e9d94c770b8c4ef584e906c7583e74864786a58d47de101f2767d50c0b/flake8-3.5.0-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: enum34; python_version < "3.4" in /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from flake8)
Requirement already satisfied: configparser; python_version < "3.2" in /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from flake8)
Requirement already satisfied: pycodestyle<2.4.0,>=2.0.0 in /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from flake8)
Requirement already satisfied: pyflakes<1.7.0,>=1.5.0 in /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from flake8)
Requirement already satisfied: mccabe<0.7.0,>=0.6.0 in /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from flake8)
Installing collected packages: flake8
Successfully installed flake8-3.5.0
```
I'm on Fedora 28.
The same problem appears when I uninstall the pip flake8 and install Fedora's package `python2-flake8-3.4.1-3.fc28`.

**Exact, unmodified output of `flake8 --bug-report`**
```
$ flake8 --bug-report
{
  "dependencies": [
    {
      "dependency": "setuptools", 
      "version": "39.0.1"
    }
  ], 
  "platform": {
    "python_implementation": "CPython", 
    "python_version": "2.7.14", 
    "system": "Linux"
  }, 
  "plugins": [
    {
      "is_local": false, 
      "plugin": "ProxyChecker", 
      "version": "0.0.1"
    }, 
    {
      "is_local": false, 
      "plugin": "hacking.core", 
      "version": "0.0.1"
    }, 
    {
      "is_local": false, 
      "plugin": "mccabe", 
      "version": "0.6.1"
    }, 
    {
      "is_local": false, 
      "plugin": "pycodestyle", 
      "version": "2.3.1"
    }, 
    {
      "is_local": false, 
      "plugin": "pyflakes", 
      "version": "1.6.0"
    }
  ], 
  "version": "3.5.0"
}
```

**Problem**

The flake8 tracebacks with whatever file I try to analyze.
```
$ cat test.py 
import os
```

```
$ flake8 test.py 
Exception in thread Thread-3:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 804, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/threading.py", line 757, in run
    self.__target(*self.__args, **self.__kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 392, in _handle_results
    task = get()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/flake8/exceptions.py", line 66, in __init__
    self.original_exception = kwargs.pop('exception')
KeyError: 'exception'
```

Fun fact: I found it out when using VS Code Python extension (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-python/issues/1653)
